arts.ttl: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Villa eyeing Palace's Eze
arts.sum: - Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim wants to sign Crystal Palace attacking midfielder Eberechi Eze, reports The Sun, although they add that there will be competition from Aston Villa if they are unable to keep Marcus Rashford . Manchester United want Eberechi Eze but face competition from Aston Villa, who will also propose a swap deal involving Marcus Rashford and Ollie Watkins .

arts.ttl: FPL notes: Glasner on Eze sub + midweek team selection
arts.sum: Gameweek 33 notes on the stalemate at Selhurst Park The post FPL notes: Glasner on Eze sub + midweek team selection appeared first on Best FPL Tips, Advice, Team News, Picks, and Statistics from Fantasy Football Scout.

arts.ttl: Iraola guides Bournemouth to another record - can they keep him?
arts.sum: Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola gave a coy response when asked about his future after the frustrating goalless draw at Crystal Palace, but supporters remain desperate for him to extend his stay at Vitality Stadium.

arts.ttl: Iraola brands Crystal Palace draw a 'missed opportunity' as Bournemouth lose ground in push for Europe
arts.sum: Bournemouth slip up in the push for European qualification

arts.ttl: Bournemouth boss Andoni Iraola fumes over point claimed at 10-man Crystal Palace
arts.sum: Chris Richards was controversially sent off with a second yellow card in first-half stoppage time of a contest which never found a flow.

arts.ttl: Glasner: It’s a huge point under the circumstances
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner was proud of Crystal Palace’s second-half performance as they kept a high-scoring Bournemouth side at bay – despite having a man fewer at Selhurst Park.
Oliver Glasner is '"very pleased" after his 10-man Crystal Palace side were able to hold Bournemouth to a 0-0 draw at Selhurst Park.

arts.ttl: ‘Either two red cards or no red card’ - Crystal Palace boss asked if Bournemouth midfielder should have been sent off along with Chris Richards
arts.sum: Palace were reduced to 10 men just before half-time when Chris Richards was shown a second yellow card for pulling down Justin Kluivert around the halfway line. The USA centre-back was issued with his marching orders by referee Sam Barrott despite Bournemouth midfielder Scott escaping a red card for a second bookable offence for a foul on Ismaila Sarr 10 minutes before.
Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola is "disappointed" after his side were unable to beat 10-man Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park.

arts.ttl: Bournemouth falter in race for Europe as 10-man Crystal Palace scrape draw
arts.sum: It is unlikely anyone here will remember this game fondly in years to come. Bournemouth missed the chance to make up ground in the race for European football next season as 10-man Crystal Palace stood firm after a week in which they conceded five goals twice in two matches. A red card for Chris Richards at the end of the first half left Oliver Glasner’s side with an uphill task to make it five successive home wins after the referee, Sam Barrott, had bizarrely decided against meting out the same punishment to Bournemouth’s Alex Scott. But while some of Palace’s players looked like their minds were on next weekend’s trip to Wembley, Andoni Iraola will be frustrated that his team could not take advantage as they failed to win for an 11th successive game in London since their triumph here in December 2023.
